## Discussion

The tube is centered in its local coordinate system. For example, if a tube has a height of `10.0`, its base lies in the plane whose y-coordinate is `-5.0` and its top is in the plane whose y-coordinate is `5.0`. The default height is `1.0`. A height of zero or less creates an empty geometry.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

# height

**Instance Property**

The extent of the tube along its y-axis. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var height: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

The tube is centered in its local coordinate system. For example, if a tube has a height of `10.0`, its base lies in the plane whose y-coordinate is `-5.0` and its top is in the plane whose y-coordinate is `5.0`. The default height is `1.0`. A height of zero or less creates an empty geometry.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Adjusting a Tube’s Dimensions

- **outerRadius**: The radius of the tube’s outer circular cross section. Animatable.
- **innerRadius**: The radius of the circular hole through the tube. Animatable.
